text: ABC patient assessment: Determine if the arrhythmia is causing serious cardiovascular compromise with altered heart rate, cardiac output, and blood pressure. Obtain senior help if needed Assess the anaesthetic. Check: * Oxygenation ¢ Ventilation and end tidal CO, ¢ Is anaesthetic too light for surgery? ¢ Drug error/interaction? Assess the surgery. Check for: * Vagal stimulation from ocular/peritoneal traction * Possible air/fat embolism * Unexpected haemorrhage & hypovolaemia ¢ Mediastinal manipulation ¢ Adrenaline injection Record a 12 lead ECG where possible and correct the underlying cause
